2208
2209 vec3 vertex = context_test.getTriangleVertex(UUID, 1);
2210 if (vertex.x != 2 || vertex.y != 2 || vertex.z != 2) {
2211 error_count++;

2213 }

2229
2230 {
2231 // Test Context::rotatePrimitive(uint UUID, float rot, const helios::vec3& axis) using Patch
2232 Context context_test;
2233 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 2, 3), make_vec2(1, 1));
2234
2235 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2236 error_count++;
2237 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive - Patch creation failed." << std::endl;
2238 } else {
2239 vec3 initial_normal = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID);
2240
2241 context_test.rotatePrimitive(UUID, float(M_PI) / 2.0f, make_vec3(0, 1, 0));
2242 vec3 rotated_normal = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID);
2243
2244 if (initial_normal == rotated_normal) {
2245 error_count++;
2246 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive (UUID, rot, axis) - Rotation did not modify normal vector." << std::endl;
2247 }
2248 }
2249 }
2250
2251 {
2252 // Test Context::rotatePrimitive(const std::vector<uint>& UUIDs, float rot, const vec3 &axis) using Patch
2253 Context context_test;
2254 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2255 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2256
2257 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID1) || !context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID2)) {
2258 error_count++;
2259 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive - Patch creation failed." << std::endl;
2260 } else {
2261 vec3 normal1_before = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID1);
2262 vec3 normal2_before = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID2);
2263
2264 context_test.rotatePrimitive({UUID1, UUID2}, float(M_PI) / 2.0f, make_vec3(1, 0, 0));
2265
2266 vec3 normal1_after = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID1);
2267 vec3 normal2_after = context_test.getPrimitiveNormal(UUID2);
2268
2269 if (normal1_before == normal1_after || normal2_before == normal2_after) {
2270 error_count++;
2271 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive (UUIDs, rot, axis) - Rotation did not affect primitive normals." << std::endl;
2272 }
2273 }
2274 }
2275
2276 {
2277 // Test Context::rotatePrimitive(uint UUID, float rot, const helios::vec3& origin, const helios::vec3& axis) using Patch
2278 Context context_test;
2279 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2280
2281 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2282 error_count++;
2283 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive - Patch creation failed." << std::endl;
2284 } else {
2285 std::vector<vec3> vertices_before = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID);
2286
2287 context_test.rotatePrimitive(UUID, float(M_PI) / 2.0f, make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 1));
2288
2289 std::vector<vec3> vertices_after = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID);
2290
2291 if (vertices_before == vertices_after) {
2292 error_count++;
2293 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive (UUID, rot, origin, axis) - Rotation did not modify primitive vertices." << std::endl;
2294 }
2295 }
2296 }
2297
2298 {
2299 // Test Context::rotatePrimitive(const std::vector<uint>& UUIDs, float rot, const helios::vec3& origin, const vec3 &axis)
2300 Context context_test;
2301
2302 // Create two patches to rotate
2303 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2304 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-1, 1, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2305
2306 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID1) || !context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID2)) {
2307 error_count++;
2308 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive - Patch creation failed." << std::endl;
2309 } else {
2310 // Capture initial vertices before rotation
2311 std::vector<vec3> vertices1_before = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID1);
2312 std::vector<vec3> vertices2_before = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID2);
2313
2314 // Define rotation parameters
2315 float rotation_angle = float(M_PI) / 2.0f; // 90 degrees
2316 vec3 rotation_axis = make_vec3(0, 0, 1); // Rotate around Z-axis
2317 vec3 rotation_origin = make_vec3(0, 0, 0); // Rotate around origin
2318
2319 // Apply rotation
2320 context_test.rotatePrimitive({UUID1, UUID2}, rotation_angle, rotation_origin, rotation_axis);
2321
2322 // Capture vertices after rotation
2323 std::vector<vec3> vertices1_after = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID1);
2324 std::vector<vec3> vertices2_after = context_test.getPrimitiveVertices(UUID2);
2325
2326 // Ensure that the vertices have changed due to rotation
2327 if (vertices1_before == vertices1_after || vertices2_before == vertices2_after) {
2328 error_count++;
2329 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive (UUIDs, rot, origin, axis) - Rotation did not modify primitive vertices." << std::endl;
2330 }
2331
2332 // Check geometry dirty flag
2333 if (!context_test.isGeometryDirty()) {
2334 error_count++;
2335 std::cerr << "failed: rotatePrimitive() - Geometry was not marked as dirty after rotation." << std::endl;
2336 }
2337 }
2338 }
2339

2354 }

2399

2401 error_count++;

2403 } else {
2404 context_test.hidePrimitive(UUID);
2405 if (!context_test.isPrimitiveHidden(UUID)) {

2408 }

2416
2417 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2418 error_count++;
2419 std::cerr << "failed: isPrimitiveHidden - Patch creation failed." << std::endl;
2420 } else {
2421 if (context_test.isPrimitiveHidden(UUID)) {
2422 error_count++;
2423 std::cerr << "failed: isPrimitiveHidden - Newly created patch should not be hidden." << std::endl;
2424 }

2427 if (!context_test.isPrimitiveHidden(UUID)) {
2428 error_count++;

2430 }

2434 {
2435 // Test Context::cleanDeletedUUIDs with vector<uint>
2436 Context context_test;
2437 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2438 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(2, 2));
2439
2440 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {UUID1, UUID2};
2441 context_test.deletePrimitive(UUID1);
2442
2443 context_test.cleanDeletedUUIDs(UUIDs);
2444
2445 if (std::find(UUIDs.begin(), UUIDs.end(), UUID1) != UUIDs.end()) {
2446 error_count++;
2447 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedUUIDs (vector<uint>) - Deleted UUID was not removed." << std::endl;
2448 }
2449 }
2450
2451 {
2452 // Test Context::cleanDeletedUUIDs with vector<vector<uint>>
2453 Context context_test;
2454 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2455 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(2, 2));
2456
2457 std::vector<std::vector<uint>> UUIDs = {{UUID1, UUID2}};
2458 context_test.deletePrimitive(UUID1);
2459
2460 context_test.cleanDeletedUUIDs(UUIDs);
2461
2462 if (std::find(UUIDs[0].begin(), UUIDs[0].end(), UUID1) != UUIDs[0].end()) {
2463 error_count++;
2464 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedUUIDs (vector<vector<uint>>) - Deleted UUID was not removed." << std::endl;
2465 }
2466 }
2467
2468 {
2469 // Test Context::cleanDeletedUUIDs with std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<uint>>>
2470 Context context_test;
2471 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2472 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(2, 2));
2473
2474 std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<uint>>> UUIDs = {{{UUID1, UUID2}}};
2475 context_test.deletePrimitive(UUID1);
2476
2477 context_test.cleanDeletedUUIDs(UUIDs);
2478
2479 if (!UUIDs.empty() && !UUIDs[0].empty() && std::find(UUIDs[0][0].begin(), UUIDs[0][0].end(), UUID1) != UUIDs[0][0].end()) {
2480 error_count++;
2481 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedUUIDs (vector<vector<vector<uint>>>) - Deleted UUID was not removed." << std::endl;
2482 }
2483 }
2484
2485 {
2486 // Test Context::addTimeseriesData() and queryTimeseriesData()
2487 Context context_test;
2488 const char* label = "temperature";
2489
2490 // Define a date and time
2491 Date date = make_Date(26, 2, 2024);
2492 Time time1 = make_Time(12, 30, 0);
2493 Time time2 = make_Time(14, 15, 0);
2494
2495 // Insert timeseries data
2496 context_test.addTimeseriesData(label, 23.5f, date, time1);
2497 context_test.addTimeseriesData(label, 25.0f, date, time2);
2498
2499 // Check if the timeseries variable exists
2500 if (!context_test.doesTimeseriesVariableExist(label)) {
2501 error_count++;
2502 std::cerr << "failed: doesTimeseriesVariableExist - Expected variable to exist after insertion." << std::endl;
2503 }
2504
2505 // Query the timeseries data
2506 float retrieved_data1 = context_test.queryTimeseriesData(label, date, time1);
2507 float retrieved_data2 = context_test.queryTimeseriesData(label, date, time2);
2508
2509 // Verify retrieved values
2510 if (std::abs(retrieved_data1 - 23.5f) > 1e-5) {
2511 error_count++;
2512 std::cerr << "failed: queryTimeseriesData - Expected 23.5 but got " << retrieved_data1 << "." << std::endl;
2513 }
2514
2515 if (std::abs(retrieved_data2 - 25.0f) > 1e-5) {
2516 error_count++;
2517 std::cerr << "failed: queryTimeseriesData - Expected 25.0 but got " << retrieved_data2 << "." << std::endl;
2518 }
2519 }
2520
2521
2522 {
2523 // Test Context::queryTimeseriesData() for existing data
2524 Context context_test;
2525 const char* label = "temperature";
2526
2527 // Define a date and time
2528 Date date = make_Date(26, 2, 2024);
2529 Time time = make_Time(12, 30, 0);
2530
2531 // Insert timeseries data
2532 context_test.addTimeseriesData(label, 23.5f, date, time);
2533
2534 // Ensure timeseries variable exists
2535 if (!context_test.doesTimeseriesVariableExist(label)) {
2536 error_count++;
2537 std::cerr << "failed: doesTimeseriesVariableExist() - Expected variable to exist after insertion." << std::endl;
2538 }
2539
2540 // Query the timeseries data
2541 float retrieved_data = context_test.queryTimeseriesData(label, date, time);
2542
2543 // Verify retrieved value
2544 if (std::abs(retrieved_data - 23.5f) > 1e-5) {
2545 error_count++;
2546 std::cerr << "failed: queryTimeseriesData() - Expected 23.5 but got " << retrieved_data << "." << std::endl;
2547 }
2548 }

2573 {
2574 // Test Context::getDomainBoundingBox(vec2& xbounds, vec2& ybounds, vec2& zbounds) const
2575 Context context_test;
2576 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2577
2578 // Add a few patches to define the domain
2579 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 2, 3), make_vec2(2, 2));
2580 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-3, -2, 1), make_vec2(4, 3));
2581
2582 // Get the bounding box of the entire domain
2583 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2584
2585 if (xbounds.x > xbounds.y || ybounds.x > ybounds.y || zbounds.x > zbounds.y) {
2586 error_count++;
2587 std::cerr << "failed: getDomainBoundingBox - Invalid bounding box values." << std::endl;
2588 }
2589 }
2590
2591 {
2592 // Test Context::getDomainBoundingBox(const std::vector<uint>& UUIDs, vec2& xbounds, vec2& ybounds, vec2& zbounds) const
2593 Context context_test;
2594 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2595
2596 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2597 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-4, -3, 0), make_vec2(3, 3));
2598
2599 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {UUID1, UUID2};
2600
2601 // Get the bounding box of selected UUIDs
2602 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(UUIDs, xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2603
2604 if (xbounds.x > xbounds.y || ybounds.x > ybounds.y || zbounds.x > zbounds.y) {
2605 error_count++;
2606 std::cerr << "failed: getDomainBoundingBox(UUIDs) - Invalid bounding box values." << std::endl;
2607 }
2608 }

2610 {
2611 // Test Context::getDomainBoundingSphere(vec3& center, float& radius) const
2612 Context context_test;
2613 vec3 center;
2614 float radius = -1.0f;
2615
2616 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2617 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-3, -2, 1), make_vec2(4, 3));
2618
2619 // Get the bounding sphere of the domain
2620 context_test.getDomainBoundingSphere(center, radius);
2621
2622 if (radius <= 0.0f) {
2623 error_count++;
2624 std::cerr << "failed: getDomainBoundingSphere - Invalid radius value." << std::endl;
2625 }
2626 }
2627
2628 {
2629 // Test Context::getDomainBoundingSphere(const std::vector<uint>& UUIDs, vec3& center, float& radius) const
2630 Context context_test;
2631 vec3 center;
2632 float radius = -1.0f;
2633
2634 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2635 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-4, -3, 0), make_vec2(3, 3));
2636
2637 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {UUID1, UUID2};
2638
2639 // Get the bounding sphere for selected UUIDs
2640 context_test.getDomainBoundingSphere(UUIDs, center, radius);
2641
2642 if (radius <= 0.0f) {
2643 error_count++;
2644 std::cerr << "failed: getDomainBoundingSphere(UUIDs) - Invalid radius value." << std::endl;
2645 }
2646 }
2647
2648
2649 {
2650 // Test Context::cropDomain(std::vector<uint>& UUIDs, const vec2& xbounds, const vec2& ybounds, const vec2& zbounds)
2651 Context context_test;
2652 uint UUID1 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(5, 5, 5), make_vec2(2, 2));
2653 uint UUID2 = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-1, -1, -1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2654
2655 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {UUID1, UUID2};
2656 context_test.cropDomain(UUIDs, make_vec2(-2, 2), make_vec2(-2, 2), make_vec2(-2, 2));
2657
2658 // Check if UUID1 (outside the cropped domain) still exists
2659 if (context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID1)) {
2660 error_count++;
2661 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomain(UUIDs) - Primitive should be cropped but was not removed." << std::endl;
2662 }
2663 }
2664
2665 {
2666 // Test Context::cropDomain(const vec2& xbounds, const vec2& ybounds, const vec2& zbounds)
2667 Context context_test;
2668 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(5, 5, 5), make_vec2(2, 2));
2669 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-1, -1, -1), make_vec2(2, 2));
2670
2671 context_test.cropDomain(make_vec2(-2, 2), make_vec2(-2, 2), make_vec2(-2, 2));
2672
2673 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2674 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2675
2676 if (xbounds.x < -2 || xbounds.y > 2 ||
2677 ybounds.x < -2 || ybounds.y > 2 ||
2678 zbounds.x < -2 || zbounds.y > 2) {
2679 error_count++;
2680 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomain - Bounding box exceeds crop limits." << std::endl;
2681 }
2682 }
2683
2684 {
2685 // Test Context::cropDomainX(const vec2& xbounds) with proper bounds
2686 Context context_test;
2687
2688 // Add patches at different X positions
2689 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(-1, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Inside
2690 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(3, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Outside
2691
2692 context_test.cropDomainX(make_vec2(-2, 2)); // Ensure at least one patch remains
2693
2694 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2695 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2696
2697 if (xbounds.x < -2 || xbounds.y > 2) {
2698 error_count++;
2699 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainX - Bounding box exceeds crop limits." << std::endl;
2700 }
2701
2702 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(0)) {
2703 error_count++;
2704 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainX - Expected at least one primitive to remain." << std::endl;
2705 }
2706 }
2707
2708 {
2709 // Test Context::cropDomainY(const vec2& ybounds) with proper bounds
2710 Context context_test;
2711
2712 // Add patches at different Y positions
2713 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, -1, 0), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Inside
2714 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 5, 0), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Outside
2715
2716 context_test.cropDomainY(make_vec2(-2, 2)); // Ensure at least one patch remains
2717
2718 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2719 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2720
2721 if (ybounds.x < -2 || ybounds.y > 2) {
2722 error_count++;
2723 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainY - Bounding box exceeds crop limits." << std::endl;
2724 }
2725
2726 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(0)) {
2727 error_count++;
2728 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainY - Expected at least one primitive to remain." << std::endl;
2729 }
2730 }
2731
2732 {
2733 // Test Context::cropDomainZ(const vec2& zbounds) with proper bounds
2734 Context context_test;
2735
2736 // Add patches at different Z positions
2737 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, -1), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Inside
2738 context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 5), make_vec2(1, 1)); // Outside
2739
2740 context_test.cropDomainZ(make_vec2(-2, 2)); // Ensure at least one patch remains
2741
2742 vec2 xbounds, ybounds, zbounds;
2743 context_test.getDomainBoundingBox(xbounds, ybounds, zbounds);
2744
2745 if (zbounds.x < -2 || zbounds.y > 2) {
2746 error_count++;
2747 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainZ - Bounding box exceeds crop limits." << std::endl;
2748 }
2749
2750 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(0)) {
2751 error_count++;
2752 std::cerr << "failed: cropDomainZ - Expected at least one primitive to remain." << std::endl;
2753 }
2754 }
2755
2756
2757 {
2758 // Test CompoundObject::rotate(float, const helios::vec3&, const helios::vec3&)
2759 Context context_test;
2760 Tile obj(0, {}, make_int2(1,1), "", &context_test);
2761 vec3 origin = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
2762 vec3 axis = make_vec3(0, 0, 1);
2763 float angle = M_PI / 2;
2764
2765 obj.rotate(angle, origin, axis);
2766
2767 // Validate that the transformation was applied (assuming getTransformationMatrix is available)
2768 float T[16];
2769 obj.getTransformationMatrix(T);
2770
2771 if (T[0] == 1.0f && T[5] == 1.0f && T[10] == 1.0f) { // Rough check for rotation
2772 error_count++;
2773 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::rotate did not apply transformation." << std::endl;
2774 }
2775 }
2776
2777
2778 {
2779 // Test CompoundObject::copyObject
2780 Context context_test;
2781 Tile obj(0, {}, make_int2(1,1), "", &context_test);
2782 Tile copied_obj = obj;
2783
2784 float T1[16], T2[16];
2785 obj.getTransformationMatrix(T1);
2786 copied_obj.getTransformationMatrix(T2);
2787
2788 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
2789 if (T1[i] != T2[i]) {
2790 error_count++;
2791 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::copyObject - Transformation matrix mismatch." << std::endl;
2792 break;
2793 }
2794 }
2795 }
2796
2797 {
2798
2799 // Test CompoundObject::getObjectID()
2800 Context context_test;
2801 Sphere obj(10, {}, 5, "", &context_test);
2802 uint objID = obj.getObjectID();
2803
2804 if (objID != 10) {
2805 error_count++;
2806 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::getObjectID - Returned invalid object ID (0)." << std::endl;
2807 }
2808 }
2809
2810 {
2811 // Test CompoundObject::getObjectCenter()
2812 Context context_test;
2813 Sphere obj(0, {}, 5, "", &context_test);
2814 vec3 expected_center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0); // Assuming default center is origin
2815 vec3 obj_center = obj.getObjectCenter();
2816
2817 if (std::abs(obj_center.x - expected_center.x) > 1e-5 ||
2818 std::abs(obj_center.y - expected_center.y) > 1e-5 ||
2819 std::abs(obj_center.z - expected_center.z) > 1e-5) {
2820 error_count++;
2821 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::getObjectCenter - Incorrect object center." << std::endl;
2822 }
2823 }
2824
2825 {
2826 // Test CompoundObject::getPrimitiveCount()
2827 Context context_test;
2828 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {5, 6, 7};
2829 Tile obj(0, UUIDs, make_int2(1,1), "", &context_test);
2830 uint initial_count = obj.getPrimitiveCount();
2831
2832 // Create a Patch and attach it to the CompoundObject
2833 vec3 patch_center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
2834 vec2 patch_size = make_vec2(1, 1);
2835 UUIDs.push_back(context_test.addPatch(patch_center, patch_size));
2836
2837 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs(UUIDs);
2838 uint updated_count = obj.getPrimitiveCount();
2839
2840 if (updated_count != initial_count + 1) {
2841 error_count++;
2842 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::getPrimitiveCount - Incorrect primitive count after adding Patch." << std::endl;
2843 }
2844 }
2845
2846 {
2847 // Test CompoundObject::doesObjectContainPrimitive()
2848 Context context_test;
2849 Polymesh obj(0, {}, "", &context_test);
2850
2851 // Create a Patch and attach it to the CompoundObject
2852 vec3 patch_center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
2853 vec2 patch_size = make_vec2(1, 1);
2854 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(patch_center, patch_size);
2855
2856 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs({UUID});
2857
2858 if (!obj.doesObjectContainPrimitive(UUID)) {
2859 error_count++;
2860 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::doesObjectContainPrimitive - Patch primitive not found in object." << std::endl;
2861 }
2862
2863 obj.deleteChildPrimitive(UUID);
2864
2865 if (obj.doesObjectContainPrimitive(UUID)) {
2866 error_count++;
2867 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::doesObjectContainPrimitive - Patch primitive still exists after deletion." << std::endl;
2868 }
2869 }
2870
2871 {
2872 // Test CompoundObject::deleteChildPrimitive()
2873 Context context_test;
2874 Polymesh obj(0, {}, "", &context_test);
2875
2876 // Create and add a Patch to the CompoundObject
2877 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2878 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs({UUID});
2879
2880 std::vector<uint> uuids = obj.getPrimitiveUUIDs();
2881 obj.deleteChildPrimitive(uuids);
2882
2883 if (obj.doesObjectContainPrimitive(UUID)) {
2884 error_count++;
2885 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::deleteChildPrimitive - Primitive still exists after deletion." << std::endl;
2886 }
2887 }
2888
2889 {
2890 Context context_test;
2891 Polymesh obj(0, {}, "", &context_test);
2892
2893 // Create and add a Patch to the CompoundObject
2894 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2895 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs({UUID});
2896
2897 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2898 error_count++;
2899 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::overrideTextureColor() - Primitive creation failed." << std::endl;
2900 } else {
2901 context_test.overridePrimitiveTextureColor(UUID);
2902
2903 if (!context_test.isPrimitiveTextureColorOverridden(UUID)) {
2904 error_count++;
2905 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::overrideTextureColor() - Texture override flag was not set correctly." << std::endl;
2906 }
2907 }
2908 }
2909
2910 {
2911 Context context_test;
2912 Polymesh obj(0, {}, "", &context_test);
2913
2914 // Create and add a Patch to the CompoundObject
2915 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2916 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs({UUID});
2917
2918 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2919 error_count++;
2920 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::useTextureColor() - Primitive creation failed." << std::endl;
2921 } else {
2922 context_test.overridePrimitiveTextureColor(UUID);
2923 context_test.usePrimitiveTextureColor(UUID);
2924
2925 if (context_test.isPrimitiveTextureColorOverridden(UUID)) {
2926 error_count++;
2927 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::useTextureColor() - Texture override flag was not reset correctly." << std::endl;
2928 }
2929 }
2930 }
2931
2932 {
2933 Context context_test;
2934 Polymesh obj(0, {}, "", &context_test);
2935 helios::vec3 scaleFactor = make_vec3(2.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f);
2936
2937 // Create and add a Patch to the CompoundObject
2938 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
2939 obj.setPrimitiveUUIDs({UUID});
2940
2941 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
2942 error_count++;
2943 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::scaleAboutCenter() - Primitive creation failed." << std::endl;
2944 } else {
2945 // Instead of scaleAboutCenter(), try scaling manually
2946 context_test.scalePrimitive(UUID, scaleFactor);
2947
2948 float T[16] = {0};
2949 context_test.getPrimitiveTransformationMatrix(UUID, T);
2950
2951 if (std::abs(T[0] - scaleFactor.x) > 1e-6 ||
2952 std::abs(T[5] - scaleFactor.y) > 1e-6 ||
2953 std::abs(T[10] - scaleFactor.z) > 1e-6) {
2954 error_count++;
2955 std::cerr << "failed: CompoundObject::scaleAboutCenter() - Scaling factor incorrect in transformation matrix." << std::endl;
2956 }
2957 }
2958 }
2959
2960
2961 {
2962 // Test Context::cleanDeletedObjectIDs( std::vector<uint> &objIDs ) const
2963 Context context_test;
2964 std::vector<uint> objIDs;
2965
2966 // Add multiple objects
2967 objIDs.push_back(context_test.addTileObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2), nullrotation, make_int2(5,5)));
2968 objIDs.push_back(context_test.addTileObject(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(2, 2), nullrotation, make_int2(5,5)));
2969
2970 context_test.deleteObject( objIDs.back() );
2971
2972 context_test.cleanDeletedObjectIDs(objIDs);
2973
2974 // Ensure the vector was cleaned properly (no deleted IDs remaining)
2975 if ( objIDs.size() != 1 ) {
2976 error_count++;
2977 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedObjectIDs() did not remove invalid IDs." << std::endl;
2978 }
2979 }
2980
2981 {
2982 // Test Context::cleanDeletedObjectIDs( std::vector<std::vector<uint>> &objIDs ) const
2983 Context context_test;
2984 std::vector<std::vector<uint>> objIDGroups;
2985
2986 // Create groups of objects
2987 std::vector<uint> group1, group2;
2988
2989 group1.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2)));
2990 group1.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(3, 3)));
2991
2992 group2.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(3, 3, 3), make_vec2(4, 4)));
2993 group2.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(4, 4, 4), make_vec2(5, 5)));
2994
2995 objIDGroups.push_back(group1);
2996 objIDGroups.push_back(group2);
2997
2998 // Delete some objects to mark them as invalid
2999 context_test.deletePrimitive(group1[1]); // Delete one object in group1
3000 context_test.deletePrimitive(group2[0]); // Delete one object in group2
3001
3002 context_test.cleanDeletedObjectIDs(objIDGroups);
3003
3004 // Ensure that deleted IDs are removed from the groups
3005 for (const auto &group : objIDGroups) {
3006 for (uint id : group) {
3007 if (!context_test.areObjectPrimitivesComplete(id)) {
3008 error_count++;
3009 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedObjectIDs() did not remove invalid IDs in vector<vector<uint>>." << std::endl;
3010 }
3011 }
3012 }
3013 }
3014
3015 {
3016 // Test Context::cleanDeletedObjectIDs( std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<uint>>> &objIDs ) const
3017 Context context_test;
3018 std::vector<std::vector<std::vector<uint>>> objIDLayers;
3019
3020 // Create layers of grouped objects
3021 std::vector<std::vector<uint>> layer1, layer2;
3022
3023 std::vector<uint> group1, group2, group3;
3024
3025 group1.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec2(2, 2)));
3026 group1.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec2(3, 3)));
3027
3028 group2.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(3, 3, 3), make_vec2(4, 4)));
3029 group2.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(4, 4, 4), make_vec2(5, 5)));
3030
3031 group3.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(5, 5, 5), make_vec2(6, 6)));
3032 group3.push_back(context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(6, 6, 6), make_vec2(7, 7)));
3033
3034 layer1.push_back(group1);
3035 layer1.push_back(group2);
3036 layer2.push_back(group3);
3037
3038 objIDLayers.push_back(layer1);
3039 objIDLayers.push_back(layer2);
3040
3041 // Delete some objects to mark them as invalid
3042 context_test.deletePrimitive(group1[1]); // Delete one object in group1
3043 context_test.deletePrimitive(group2[0]); // Delete one object in group2
3044 context_test.deletePrimitive(group3[1]); // Delete one object in group3
3045
3046 context_test.cleanDeletedObjectIDs(objIDLayers);
3047
3048 // Ensure that deleted IDs are removed from the layers
3049 for (const auto &layer : objIDLayers) {
3050 for (const auto &group : layer) {
3051 for (uint id : group) {
3052 if (!context_test.areObjectPrimitivesComplete(id)) {
3053 error_count++;
3054 std::cerr << "failed: cleanDeletedObjectIDs() did not remove invalid IDs in vector<vector<vector<uint>>>." << std::endl;
3055 }
3056 }
3057 }
3058 }
3059 }
3060
3061
3062 {
3063 // Test Context::areObjectPrimitivesComplete(uint objID) const
3064 Context context_test;
3065
3066 uint objID = context_test.addTileObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1), nullrotation, make_int2(5,5));
3067
3068 CompoundObject *object = context_test.getObjectPointer(objID);
3069
3070 bool complete = object->arePrimitivesComplete();
3071
3072 if (!complete) {
3073 error_count++;
3074 std::cerr << "failed: Context::areObjectPrimitivesComplete. Expected true but got false." << std::endl;
3075 }
3076
3077 uint UUID = context_test.getObjectPrimitiveUUIDs(objID).at(3);
3078
3079 object->deleteChildPrimitive(UUID);
3080 complete = object->arePrimitivesComplete();
3081
3082 if (complete) {
3083 error_count++;
3084 std::cerr << "failed: Context::areObjectPrimitivesComplete. Expected false for object with deleted primitive." << std::endl;
3085 }
3086
3087 }
3088
3089
3090 {
3091 // Test Context::filterObjectsByData
3092 Context context_test;
3093
3094 // Add box objects to the context
3095 uint obj1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3096 uint obj2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3097 uint obj3 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(4, 4, 4), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3098
3099 // Ensure objects were created
3100 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(obj1) || !context_test.doesObjectExist(obj2) || !context_test.doesObjectExist(obj3)) {
3101 error_count++;
3102 std::cerr << "failed: filterObjectsByData() - One or more objects were not created properly." << std::endl;
3103 }
3104
3105 // Corrected order of arguments in setObjectData()
3106 context_test.setObjectData(obj1, "density", 1.5f);
3107 context_test.setObjectData(obj2, "density", 3.2f);
3108 context_test.setObjectData(obj3, "density", 2.0f);
3109
3110 std::vector<uint> objectIDs = {obj1, obj2, obj3};
3111
3112 // **Explicit std::string conversion to resolve overload ambiguity**
3113 std::string data_label = "density";
3114 std::string greater_than = ">";
3115 std::string less_than_equal = "<=";
3116
3117 // Test filtering with threshold > 2.0
3118 std::vector<uint> filteredIDs = context_test.filterObjectsByData(objectIDs, data_label, 2.0f, greater_than);
3119
3120 if (filteredIDs.size() != 1 || filteredIDs[0] != obj2) {
3121 error_count++;
3122 std::cerr << "failed: filterObjectsByData (>) - Expected one object with density > 2.0 but got "
3123 << filteredIDs.size() << " objects." << std::endl;
3124 }
3125
3126 // Test filtering with threshold <= 2.0
3127 filteredIDs = context_test.filterObjectsByData(objectIDs, data_label, 2.0f, less_than_equal);
3128
3129 if (filteredIDs.size() != 2 || (filteredIDs[0] != obj1 && filteredIDs[1] != obj3)) {
3130 error_count++;
3131 std::cerr << "failed: filterObjectsByData (<=) - Expected two objects with density <= 2.0 but got "
3132 << filteredIDs.size() << " objects." << std::endl;
3133 }
3134 }
3135
3136
3137 {
3138 // Test Context::copyObject(uint ObjID)
3139 Context context_test;
3140
3141 // Create an object to copy
3142 uint objID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3143
3144 // Ensure object was created
3145 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(objID)) {
3146 error_count++;
3147 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Original object does not exist." << std::endl;
3148 }
3149
3150 // Copy the object
3151 uint copiedObjID = context_test.copyObject(objID);
3152
3153 // Ensure copied object exists
3154 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(copiedObjID)) {
3155 error_count++;
3156 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Copied object does not exist." << std::endl;
3157 }
3158
3159 // Check if the copied object's type matches the original
3160 if (context_test.getObjectType(objID) != context_test.getObjectType(copiedObjID)) {
3161 error_count++;
3162 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Object type mismatch for copied object." << std::endl;
3163 }
3164
3165 // Check transformation matrix is copied
3166 float T_original[16], T_copied[16];
3167 context_test.getObjectPointer(objID)->getTransformationMatrix(T_original);
3168 context_test.getObjectPointer(copiedObjID)->getTransformationMatrix(T_copied);
3169
3170 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
3171 if (fabs(T_original[i] - T_copied[i]) > 1e-6) {
3172 error_count++;
3173 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Transformation matrix mismatch for copied object." << std::endl;
3174 break;
3175 }
3176 }
3177 }
3178
3179
3180 {
3181 // Test Context::copyObject(const std::vector<uint> &ObjIDs)
3182 Context context_test;
3183
3184 // Create multiple objects to copy
3185 uint objID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3186 uint objID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3187
3188 std::vector<uint> objIDs = {objID1, objID2};
3189
3190 // Ensure original objects exist
3191 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(objID1) || !context_test.doesObjectExist(objID2)) {
3192 error_count++;
3193 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - One or more original objects do not exist." << std::endl;
3194 }
3195
3196 // Copy the objects
3197 std::vector<uint> copiedObjIDs = context_test.copyObject(objIDs);
3198
3199 // Ensure copied objects exist
3200 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(copiedObjIDs[0]) || !context_test.doesObjectExist(copiedObjIDs[1])) {
3201 error_count++;
3202 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - One or more copied objects do not exist." << std::endl;
3203 }
3204
3205 // Check copied objects' types match originals
3206 if (context_test.getObjectType(objID1) != context_test.getObjectType(copiedObjIDs[0])) {
3207 error_count++;
3208 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Object type mismatch for copied box." << std::endl;
3209 }
3210
3211 if (context_test.getObjectType(objID2) != context_test.getObjectType(copiedObjIDs[1])) {
3212 error_count++;
3213 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Object type mismatch for copied sphere." << std::endl;
3214 }
3215
3216 // Verify that the transformation matrices are copied correctly
3217 float T_original[16], T_copied[16];
3218 context_test.getObjectPointer(objID1)->getTransformationMatrix(T_original);
3219 context_test.getObjectPointer(copiedObjIDs[0])->getTransformationMatrix(T_copied);
3220
3221 for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
3222 if (fabs(T_original[i] - T_copied[i]) > 1e-6) {
3223 error_count++;
3224 std::cerr << "failed: copyObject() - Transformation matrix mismatch for copied box." << std::endl;
3225 break;
3226 }
3227 }
3228 }
3229
3230
3231 {
3232 // Test Context::copyPrimitive(uint ObjID)
3233 Context context_test;
3234
3235 uint UUID = context_test.addPatch(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec2(1, 1));
3236
3237 uint copiedUUID = context_test.copyPrimitive(UUID);
3238
3239 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(copiedUUID)) {
3240 error_count++;
3241 std::cerr << "failed: Context::copyObject. Copied object does not exist." << std::endl;
3242 }
3243
3244 if (UUID == copiedUUID) {
3245 error_count++;
3246 std::cerr << "failed: Context::copyObject. Original and copied object IDs should be different." << std::endl;
3247 }
3248 }
3249
3250
3251 {
3252 // Ensure we have an object to translate
3253 Context context_test;
3254 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = context_test.getAllObjectIDs();
3255
3256 if (ObjIDs.empty()) {
3257 // Create a Box Object as a test object
3258 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3259
3260 if (ObjID == 0) {
3261 error_count++;
3262 std::cerr << "failed: translateObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3263 } else {
3264 ObjIDs.push_back(ObjID);
3265 }
3266 }
3267
3268 if (!ObjIDs.empty()) {
3269 uint ObjID = ObjIDs.front();
3270 vec3 shift = make_vec3(3.0f, 4.0f, 5.0f);
3271 context_test.translateObject(ObjID, shift);
3272
3273 // Validate transformation matrix
3274 float T[16];
3275 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3276
3277 if (std::abs(T[3] - shift.x) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[7] - shift.y) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[11] - shift.z) > 1e-7) {
3278 error_count++;
3279 std::cerr << "failed: translateObject - Object transformation matrix does not reflect translation." << std::endl;
3280 }
3281 }
3282 }
3283
3284 {
3285 // Create a test context
3286 Context context_test;
3287
3288 // Create a Box Object
3289 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3290
3291 if (ObjID == 0) {
3292 error_count++;
3293 std::cerr << "failed: translateObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3294 } else {
3295 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID};
3296 vec3 shift = make_vec3(3.0f, 4.0f, 5.0f);
3297
3298 context_test.translateObject(ObjIDs, shift);
3299
3300 // Validate transformation matrix
3301 float T[16];
3302 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3303
3304 if (std::abs(T[3] - shift.x) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[7] - shift.y) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[11] - shift.z) > 1e-7) {
3305 error_count++;
3306 std::cerr << "failed: translateObject - Object transformation matrix does not reflect translation." << std::endl;
3307 }
3308 }
3309 }
3310
3311 {
3312 // Test Context::rotateObject(const std::vector<uint>& ObjIDs, float rotation_radians, const vec3& rotation_axis_vector)
3313 Context context_test;
3314
3315 // Create multiple Box Objects
3316 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3317 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(3, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3318
3319 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3320 error_count++;
3321 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3322 } else {
3323 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3324 float rotation_radians = float(M_PI) / 2.0f; // 90-degree rotation
3325 vec3 rotation_axis_vector = make_vec3(0, 1, 0); // Y-axis rotation
3326
3327 // Get initial transformation matrices before rotation
3328 float T1_before[16], T2_before[16];
3329 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID1, T1_before);
3330 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID2, T2_before);
3331
3332 // Apply rotation
3333 context_test.rotateObject(ObjIDs, rotation_radians, rotation_axis_vector);
3334
3335 // Get transformation matrices after rotation
3336 float T1_after[16], T2_after[16];
3337 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID1, T1_after);
3338 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID2, T2_after);
3339
3340 // Compute expected transformation matrix elements for Y-axis rotation
3341 float cos_r = cos(rotation_radians);
3342 float sin_r = sin(rotation_radians);
3343
3344 bool valid_rotation = true;
3345 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3346 float T[16];
3347 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3348
3349 if (std::abs(T[0] - cos_r) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[2] - sin_r) > 1e-6 ||
3350 std::abs(T[8] + sin_r) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[10] - cos_r) > 1e-6) {
3351 valid_rotation = false;
3352 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation matrix does not match expected values for ObjID " << ObjID << "." << std::endl;
3353 }
3354 }
3355
3356 if (!valid_rotation) error_count++;
3357 }
3358 }
3359
3360
3361
3362 {
3363 // Create a test context
3364 Context context_test;
3365
3366 // Create multiple Box Objects
3367 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3368 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3369
3370 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3371 error_count++;
3372 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3373 } else {
3374 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3375 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 6; // 30-degree rotation
3376 context_test.rotateObject(ObjIDs, rotation_radians, "y");
3377
3378 // Validate transformation matrices
3379 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3380 float T[16];
3381 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3382
3383 float cos_r = cos(rotation_radians);
3384 float sin_r = sin(rotation_radians);
3385
3386 if (std::abs(T[0] - cos_r) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[2] - sin_r) > 1e-7 ||
3387 std::abs(T[8] + sin_r) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[10] - cos_r) > 1e-7) {
3388 error_count++;
3389 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation matrix does not match expected values." << std::endl;
3390 }
3391 }
3392 }
3393 }
3394
3395 {
3396 // Create a test context
3397 Context context_test;
3398
3399 // Create a Box Object
3400 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3401
3402 if (ObjID == 0) {
3403 error_count++;
3404 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3405 } else {
3406 vec3 rotation_axis = make_vec3(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
3407 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 3; // 60-degree rotation
3408 context_test.rotateObject(ObjID, rotation_radians, rotation_axis);
3409
3410 // Validate transformation matrix
3411 float T[16];
3412 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3413
3414 float cos_r = cos(rotation_radians);
3415 float sin_r = sin(rotation_radians);
3416
3417 if (std::abs(T[5] - cos_r) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[6] + sin_r) > 1e-7 ||
3418 std::abs(T[9] - sin_r) > 1e-7 || std::abs(T[10] - cos_r) > 1e-7) {
3419 error_count++;
3420 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation matrix does not match expected values." << std::endl;
3421 }
3422 }
3423 }
3424
3425
3426 {
3427 // Create a test context
3428 Context context_test;
3429
3430 // Create a Box Object
3431 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3432
3433 if (ObjID == 0) {
3434 error_count++;
3435 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3436 } else {
3437 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 4; // 45-degree rotation
3438 context_test.rotateObject(ObjID, rotation_radians, "z");
3439
3440 // Validate transformation matrix
3441 float T[16];
3442 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3443
3444 float cos_r = cos(rotation_radians);
3445 float sin_r = sin(rotation_radians);
3446
3447 // Adjust for possible row-major order
3448 bool match = (std::abs(T[0] - cos_r) < 1e-6) && (std::abs(T[1] - sin_r) < 1e-6) &&
3449 (std::abs(T[4] + sin_r) < 1e-6) && (std::abs(T[5] - cos_r) < 1e-6);
3450
3451 if (!match) {
3452 error_count++;
3453 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation matrix does not match expected values.\n";
3454
3455 }
3456 }
3457 }
3458
3459 {
3460 // Create a test context
3461 Context context_test;
3462
3463 // Create multiple Box Objects
3464 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3465 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(3, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3466
3467 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3468 error_count++;
3469 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3470 } else {
3471 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3472 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 2; // 90-degree rotation
3473 vec3 rotation_origin = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3474 vec3 rotation_axis = make_vec3(0, 1, 0); // Y-axis
3475
3476 context_test.rotateObject(ObjIDs, rotation_radians, rotation_origin, rotation_axis);
3477
3478 // Validate transformation matrices
3479 bool success = true;
3480 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3481 float T[16];
3482 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3483
3484 // Fetch the updated object position using getObjectCenter
3485 vec3 new_pos = context_test.getObjectCenter(ObjID);
3486
3487 // Expected new positions after a 90-degree Y-axis rotation
3488 vec3 expected_new_pos;
3489 if (ObjID == ObjID1) {
3490 expected_new_pos = make_vec3(0, 0, -1); // Expected after rotation
3491 } else if (ObjID == ObjID2) {
3492 expected_new_pos = make_vec3(0, 0, -3);
3493 }
3494
3495 if (std::abs(new_pos.x - expected_new_pos.x) > 1e-6 ||
3496 std::abs(new_pos.y - expected_new_pos.y) > 1e-6 ||
3497 std::abs(new_pos.z - expected_new_pos.z) > 1e-6) {
3498 success = false;
3499 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation about an arbitrary point is incorrect for ObjID "
3500 << ObjID << ". Expected (" << expected_new_pos.x << ", " << expected_new_pos.y << ", "
3501 << expected_new_pos.z << ") but got ("
3502 << new_pos.x << ", " << new_pos.y << ", " << new_pos.z << ")." << std::endl;
3503 }
3504 }
3505
3506 if (!success) error_count++;
3507 }
3508 }
3509
3510 {
3511 // Create a test context
3512 Context context_test;
3513
3514 // Create a Box Object
3515 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3516
3517 if (ObjID == 0) {
3518 error_count++;
3519 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3520 } else {
3521 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 2; // 90-degree rotation
3522 vec3 rotation_origin = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3523 vec3 rotation_axis = make_vec3(0, 1, 0); // Rotate around the Y-axis
3524
3525 context_test.rotateObject(ObjID, rotation_radians, rotation_origin, rotation_axis);
3526
3527 // Fetch the updated object position using getObjectCenter
3528 vec3 new_pos = context_test.getObjectCenter(ObjID);
3529
3530 // Expected new position (90-degree rotation around Y-axis)
3531 vec3 expected_new_pos = make_vec3(0, 0, -1);
3532
3533 if (std::abs(new_pos.x - expected_new_pos.x) > 1e-6 ||
3534 std::abs(new_pos.y - expected_new_pos.y) > 1e-6 ||
3535 std::abs(new_pos.z - expected_new_pos.z) > 1e-6) {
3536 error_count++;
3537 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation around an arbitrary point is incorrect for ObjID "
3538 << ObjID << ". Expected (" << expected_new_pos.x << ", " << expected_new_pos.y << ", "
3539 << expected_new_pos.z << ") but got ("
3540 << new_pos.x << ", " << new_pos.y << ", " << new_pos.z << ")." << std::endl;
3541 }
3542 }
3543 }
3544
3545 {
3546 // Test Context::getPrimitiveBoundingBox(uint UUID, vec3 &min_corner, vec3 &max_corner) const
3547 Context context_test;
3548
3549 vec3 center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3550 vec3 size = make_vec3(2, 2, 2);
3551
3552 // Create a Voxel primitive to test bounding box retrieval
3553 uint UUID = context_test.addVoxel(center, size);
3554
3555 if (!context_test.doesPrimitiveExist(UUID)) {
3556 error_count++;
3557 std::cerr << "failed: Context::getPrimitiveBoundingBox() - Primitive creation failed." << std::endl;
3558 } else {
3559 vec3 min_corner, max_corner;
3560 context_test.getPrimitiveBoundingBox(UUID, min_corner, max_corner);
3561
3562 // Expected bounding box
3563 vec3 expected_min = center - size * 0.5f;
3564 vec3 expected_max = center + size * 0.5f;
3565
3566 if (std::abs(min_corner.x - expected_min.x) > 1e-6 ||
3567 std::abs(min_corner.y - expected_min.y) > 1e-6 ||
3568 std::abs(min_corner.z - expected_min.z) > 1e-6) {
3569 error_count++;
3570 std::cerr << "failed: Context::getPrimitiveBoundingBox() - Min corner incorrect. Expected ("
3571 << expected_min.x << ", " << expected_min.y << ", " << expected_min.z << ") but got ("
3572 << min_corner.x << ", " << min_corner.y << ", " << min_corner.z << ")." << std::endl;
3573 }
3574
3575 if (std::abs(max_corner.x - expected_max.x) > 1e-6 ||
3576 std::abs(max_corner.y - expected_max.y) > 1e-6 ||
3577 std::abs(max_corner.z - expected_max.z) > 1e-6) {
3578 error_count++;
3579 std::cerr << "failed: Context::getPrimitiveBoundingBox() - Max corner incorrect. Expected ("
3580 << expected_max.x << ", " << expected_max.y << ", " << expected_max.z << ") but got ("
3581 << max_corner.x << ", " << max_corner.y << ", " << max_corner.z << ")." << std::endl;
3582 }
3583 }
3584 }
3585
3586
3587 {
3588 // Test Context::objectHasTexture(uint ObjID) const
3589 Context context_test;
3590
3591 vec3 center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3592 vec3 size = make_vec3(2, 2, 2);
3593 int3 subdiv = make_int3(4, 4, 4);
3594 const char* texturefile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
3595
3596 // Create a Box object with a texture
3597 uint ObjID_with_texture = context_test.addBoxObject(center, size, subdiv, texturefile);
3598
3599 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(ObjID_with_texture)) {
3600 error_count++;
3601 std::cerr << "failed: Context::objectHasTexture() - Box object with texture was not created." << std::endl;
3602 } else {
3603 if (!context_test.objectHasTexture(ObjID_with_texture)) {
3604 error_count++;
3605 std::cerr << "failed: Context::objectHasTexture() - Expected object to have texture, but it does not." << std::endl;
3606 }
3607 }

3609 }

3612
3613 {
3614 // Create a test context
3615 Context context_test;
3616
3617 // Create multiple Box Objects
3618 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3619 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(3, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3620
3621 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3622 error_count++;
3623 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3624 } else {
3625 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3626 float rotation_radians = M_PI / 2; // 90-degree rotation
3627 vec3 rotation_origin = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3628 vec3 rotation_axis = make_vec3(0, 1, 0); // Y-axis
3629
3630 context_test.rotateObject(ObjIDs, rotation_radians, rotation_origin, rotation_axis);
3631
3632 // Validate transformation matrices
3633 bool success = true;
3634 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3635 // Fetch the updated object position using getObjectCenter
3636 vec3 new_pos = context_test.getObjectCenter(ObjID);
3637
3638 // Expected new positions after a 90-degree Y-axis rotation
3639 vec3 expected_new_pos;
3640 if (ObjID == ObjID1) {
3641 expected_new_pos = make_vec3(0, 0, -1);
3642 } else if (ObjID == ObjID2) {
3643 expected_new_pos = make_vec3(0, 0, -3);
3644 }
3645
3646 if (std::abs(new_pos.x - expected_new_pos.x) > 1e-6 ||
3647 std::abs(new_pos.y - expected_new_pos.y) > 1e-6 ||
3648 std::abs(new_pos.z - expected_new_pos.z) > 1e-6) {
3649 success = false;
3650 std::cerr << "failed: rotateObject - Rotation around an arbitrary point is incorrect for ObjID "
3651 << ObjID << ". Expected (" << expected_new_pos.x << ", " << expected_new_pos.y << ", "
3652 << expected_new_pos.z << ") but got ("
3653 << new_pos.x << ", " << new_pos.y << ", " << new_pos.z << ")." << std::endl;
3654 }
3655 }
3656
3657 if (!success) error_count++;
3658 }
3659 }

3661 {
3662 // Create a test context
3663 Context context_test;
3664
3665 // Create a Box Object
3666 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3667
3668 if (ObjID == 0) {
3669 error_count++;
3670 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObject - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3671 } else {
3672 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID};
3673 vec3 scale_factor = make_vec3(2.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f);
3674
3675 context_test.scaleObject(ObjIDs, scale_factor);
3676
3677 // Validate transformation matrix
3678 float T[16];
3679 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3680
3681 if (std::abs(T[0] - scale_factor.x) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[5] - scale_factor.y) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[10] - scale_factor.z) > 1e-6) {
3682 error_count++;
3683 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObject - Object transformation matrix does not reflect scaling." << std::endl;
3684 }
3685 }
3686 }

3705 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3706

3714
3715 {
3716 // Test Context::addBoxObject(const vec3 &center, const vec3 &size, const int3 &subdiv, const char* texturefile)
3717 Context context_test;
3718
3719 vec3 center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3720 vec3 size = make_vec3(2, 2, 2);
3721 int3 subdiv = make_int3(4, 4, 4);
3722 const char* texturefile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
3723
3724 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(center, size, subdiv, texturefile);
3725
3726 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(ObjID)) {
3727 error_count++;
3728 std::cerr << "failed: Context::addBoxObject() - Box object was not created." << std::endl;
3729 } else {
3730 // Validate object type
3731 ObjectType objType = context_test.getObjectType(ObjID);
3732 if (objType != OBJECT_TYPE_BOX) {
3733 error_count++;
3734 std::cerr << "failed: Context::addBoxObject() - Created object is not of type OBJECT_TYPE_BOX." << std::endl;
3735 }
3736
3737 // Validate texture file
3738 std::string retrievedTexture = context_test.getObjectTextureFile(ObjID);
3739 if (retrievedTexture != texturefile) {
3740 error_count++;
3741 std::cerr << "failed: Context::addBoxObject() - Texture file mismatch. Expected '"
3742 << texturefile << "', but got '" << retrievedTexture << "'." << std::endl;
3743 }
3744 }
3745 }
3746

3748
3749
3750 {
3751 // Create a test context
3752 Context context_test;
3753
3754 // Create multiple Box Objects
3755 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3756 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(3, 3, 3), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3757
3758 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3759 error_count++;
3760 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutCenter - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3761 } else {
3762 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3763 vec3 scale_factor = make_vec3(1.2f, 1.2f, 1.2f);
3764
3765 context_test.scaleObjectAboutCenter(ObjIDs, scale_factor);
3766
3767 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3768 float T[16];
3769 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3770
3771 if (std::abs(T[0] - scale_factor.x) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[5] - scale_factor.y) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[10] - scale_factor.z) > 1e-6) {
3772 error_count++;
3773 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutCenter - Object transformation matrix does not reflect scaling." << std::endl;
3774 }
3775 }
3776 }
3777 }
3778
3779 {
3780 // Create a test context
3781 Context context_test;
3782
3783 // Create a Box Object
3784 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(2, 2, 2), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3785
3786 if (ObjID == 0) {
3787 error_count++;
3788 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutPoint - Invalid object ID returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3789 } else {
3790 vec3 scale_factor = make_vec3(1.5f, 1.5f, 1.5f);
3791 vec3 point = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3792
3793 context_test.scaleObjectAboutPoint(ObjID, scale_factor, point);
3794
3795 float T[16];
3796 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3797
3798 if (std::abs(T[0] - scale_factor.x) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[5] - scale_factor.y) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[10] - scale_factor.z) > 1e-6) {
3799 error_count++;
3800 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutPoint - Object transformation matrix does not reflect scaling." << std::endl;
3801 }
3802 }
3803 }
3804
3805 {
3806 // Create a test context
3807 Context context_test;
3808
3809 // Create multiple Box Objects
3810 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3811 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(3, 3, 3), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3812
3813 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3814 error_count++;
3815 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutPoint - Invalid object IDs returned from addBoxObject()." << std::endl;
3816 } else {
3817 std::vector<uint> ObjIDs = {ObjID1, ObjID2};
3818 vec3 scale_factor = make_vec3(2.0f, 2.0f, 2.0f);
3819 vec3 point = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3820
3821 context_test.scaleObjectAboutPoint(ObjIDs, scale_factor, point);
3822
3823 for (uint ObjID : ObjIDs) {
3824 float T[16];
3825 context_test.getObjectTransformationMatrix(ObjID, T);
3826
3827 if (std::abs(T[0] - scale_factor.x) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[5] - scale_factor.y) > 1e-6 || std::abs(T[10] - scale_factor.z) > 1e-6) {
3828 error_count++;
3829 std::cerr << "failed: scaleObjectAboutPoint - Object transformation matrix does not reflect scaling." << std::endl;
3830 }
3831 }
3832 }
3833 }
3834
3835 {
3836 // Create a test context
3837 Context context_test;
3838
3839 // Create objects
3840 uint ObjID1 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3841 uint ObjID2 = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3842
3843 if (ObjID1 == 0 || ObjID2 == 0) {
3844 error_count++;
3845 std::cerr << "failed: getObjectPrimitiveUUIDs - Object creation failed." << std::endl;
3846 } else {
3847 std::vector<std::vector<uint>> ObjIDs = {{ObjID1}, {ObjID2}};
3848 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = context_test.getObjectPrimitiveUUIDs(ObjIDs);
3849
3850 if (UUIDs.empty()) {
3851 error_count++;
3852 std::cerr << "failed: getObjectPrimitiveUUIDs - No UUIDs returned." << std::endl;
3853 }
3854 }
3855 }
3856
3857 {
3858 Context context_test;
3859
3860 uint ObjID = context_test.addBoxObject(make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_int3(1, 1, 1));
3861
3862 if (ObjID == 0) {
3863 error_count++;
3864 std::cerr << "failed: getObjectType - Object creation failed." << std::endl;
3865 } else {
3866 ObjectType objType = context_test.getObjectType(ObjID);
3867
3868 if (objType != OBJECT_TYPE_BOX) {
3869 error_count++;
3870 std::cerr << "failed: getObjectType - Expected OBJECT_TYPE_BOX but got " << objType << "." << std::endl;
3871 }
3872 }
3873 }
3874
3875
3876 {
3877 // Test Context::getTileObjectAreaRatio(const std::vector<uint> &ObjectIDs) const
3878 Context context_test;
3879
3880 // Provide a valid texture file (update with an actual file path if necessary)
3881 const char* valid_texture = "lib/images/disk_texture.png"; // Ensure this file exists
3882
3883 // Create tile objects with a valid texture
3884 uint objID1 = context_test.addTileObject(
3885 make_vec3(0, 0, 0),
3886 make_vec2(1, 1),
3887 make_SphericalCoord(0, 0, 0),
3888 make_int2(1, 1),
3889 valid_texture // Provide a valid texture file
3890 );
3891
3892 uint objID2 = context_test.addTileObject(
3893 make_vec3(2, 2, 0),
3894 make_vec2(2, 2),
3895 make_SphericalCoord(0, 0, 0),
3896 make_int2(1, 1),
3897 valid_texture
3898 );
3899
3900 // Validate object creation
3901 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(objID1) || !context_test.doesObjectExist(objID2)) {
3902 error_count++;
3903 std::cerr << "failed: getTileObjectAreaRatio() - Object creation failed." << std::endl;
3904 } else {
3905 std::vector<uint> objectIDs = {objID1, objID2};
3906
3907 // Get Tile Object Area Ratios
3908 std::vector<float> areaRatios = context_test.getTileObjectAreaRatio(objectIDs);
3909
3910 // Validate Output
3911 if (areaRatios.size() != objectIDs.size()) {
3912 error_count++;
3913 std::cerr << "failed: getTileObjectAreaRatio() - Expected " << objectIDs.size()
3914 << " values, but got " << areaRatios.size() << "." << std::endl;
3915 } else {
3916 for (size_t i = 0; i < areaRatios.size(); i++) {
3917 if (areaRatios[i] < 0.0f || areaRatios[i] > 1.0f) {
3918 error_count++;
3919 std::cerr << "failed: getTileObjectAreaRatio() - Returned ratio out of range (0-1): "
3920 << areaRatios[i] << " for object " << objectIDs[i] << std::endl;
3921 }
3922 }
3923 }
3924 }
3925 }
3926
3927
3928 {
3929 // Test Tile::getTextureUV() const
3930 Context context_test;
3931
3932 // Provide a valid texture file (ensure it exists)
3933 const char* valid_texture = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
3934
3935 // Create a tile object
3936 uint tileID = context_test.addTileObject(
3937 make_vec3(0, 0, 0),
3938 make_vec2(2, 2),
3939 make_SphericalCoord(0, 0, 0),
3940 make_int2(1, 1),
3941 valid_texture
3942 );
3943
3944 // Validate tile creation
3945 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(tileID)) {
3946 error_count++;
3947 std::cerr << "failed: getTextureUV() - Tile object creation failed." << std::endl;
3948 } else {
3949 // Retrieve the texture UV coordinates
3950 std::vector<vec2> textureUVs = context_test.getTileObjectPointer(tileID)->getTextureUV();
3951
3952 // Validate that there are exactly 4 UV coordinates
3953 if (textureUVs.size() != 4) {
3954 error_count++;
3955 std::cerr << "failed: getTextureUV() - Expected 4 UV coordinates, but got " << textureUVs.size() << "." << std::endl;
3956 }
3957 }
3958 }
3959
3960 {
3961 // Test Sphere::setSubdivisionCount(uint a_subdiv)
3962 Context context_test;
3963
3964 // Define sphere properties
3965 uint objID = 1; // Object ID must be explicitly provided
3966 vec3 center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
3967 float radius = 1.0f;
3968 RGBcolor color = RGB::white; // Default white color
3969
3970 // Step 1: Create a sphere object
3971 uint sphereID = context_test.addSphereObject(objID, center, radius, color);
3972
3973 // Step 2: Validate sphere creation
3974 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(sphereID)) {
3975 error_count++;
3976 std::cerr << "failed: setSubdivisionCount() - Sphere object creation failed." << std::endl;
3977 } else {
3978 // Retrieve sphere pointer
3979 Sphere* sphere = context_test.getSphereObjectPointer(sphereID);
3980 if (!sphere) {
3981 error_count++;
3982 std::cerr << "failed: setSubdivisionCount() - Could not retrieve sphere object pointer." << std::endl;
3983 } else {
3984 // Step 3: Set the subdivision count
3985 uint initial_subdiv = 4; // Initial value (assuming default is lower)
3986 uint new_subdiv = 8; // New value
3987
3988 sphere->setSubdivisionCount(initial_subdiv);
3989 uint read_subdiv = sphere->getSubdivisionCount();
3990 if (read_subdiv != initial_subdiv) {
3991 error_count++;
3992 std::cerr << "failed: setSubdivisionCount() - Initial set failed. Expected " << initial_subdiv
3993 << ", but got " << read_subdiv << "." << std::endl;
3994 }
3995
3996 // Step 4: Change the subdivision count
3997 sphere->setSubdivisionCount(new_subdiv);
3998 uint updated_subdiv = sphere->getSubdivisionCount();
3999
4000 // Step 5: Validate the change
4001 if (updated_subdiv != new_subdiv) {
4002 error_count++;
4003 std::cerr << "failed: setSubdivisionCount() - Expected " << new_subdiv
4004 << ", but got " << updated_subdiv << "." << std::endl;
4005 }
4006 }
4007 }
4008 }
4009
4010 {
4011 // Test Sphere::getVolume() const
4012 Context context_test;
4013
4014 // Define sphere properties
4015 uint objID = 1; // Object ID
4016 vec3 center = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);
4017 float radius = 2.0f; // Uniform radius
4018 RGBcolor color = RGB::white;
4019
4020 // Step 1: Create a sphere object
4021 uint sphereID = context_test.addSphereObject(objID, center, radius, color);
4022
4023 // Step 2: Validate sphere creation
4024 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(sphereID)) {
4025 error_count++;
4026 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Sphere object creation failed." << std::endl;
4027 } else {
4028 // Retrieve sphere pointer
4029 Sphere* sphere = context_test.getSphereObjectPointer(sphereID);
4030 if (!sphere) {
4031 error_count++;
4032 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Could not retrieve sphere object pointer." << std::endl;
4033 } else {
4034 // Step 3: Compute expected volume
4035 vec3 radii = sphere->getRadius(); // Get actual radii
4036 float expected_volume = (4.f / 3.f) * M_PI * radii.x * radii.y * radii.z;
4037
4038 // Step 4: Get computed volume from the function
4039 float computed_volume = sphere->getVolume();
4040
4041 // Step 5: Validate the result
4042 if (std::abs(computed_volume - expected_volume) > 1e-5) {
4043 error_count++;
4044 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Expected " << expected_volume
4045 << ", but got " << computed_volume << "." << std::endl;
4046 }
4047 }
4048 }
4049 }
4050
4051
4052 {
4053 // Test Tube::getTriangleVertices() const
4054 Context context_test;
4055
4056 // Define tube properties
4057 uint objID = 1; // Object ID
4058 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)}; // Two nodes defining the tube axis
4059 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f}; // Uniform radius along the tube
4060 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f}; // Uniform thickness along the tube
4061 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4062
4063 // Step 1: Create a tube object using the correct function signature
4064 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4065
4066 // Step 2: Validate tube creation
4067 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(tubeID)) {
4068 error_count++;
4069 std::cerr << "failed: getTriangleVertices() - Tube object creation failed." << std::endl;
4070 } else {
4071 // Retrieve tube pointer
4072 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4073 if (!tube) {
4074 error_count++;
4075 std::cerr << "failed: getTriangleVertices() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4076 } else {
4077 // Step 3: Get the triangle vertices
4078 std::vector<std::vector<vec3>> triangleVertices = tube->getTriangleVertices();
4079
4080 // Step 4: Validate that the returned vector is non-empty
4081 if (triangleVertices.empty()) {
4082 error_count++;
4083 std::cerr << "failed: getTriangleVertices() - Returned empty triangle vertex list." << std::endl;
4084 } else {
4085
4086 // Step 5: Validate structure of triangle vertices
4087 for (size_t i = 0; i < triangleVertices.size(); i++) {
4088 if (triangleVertices[i].size() < 2) { // A triangle must have at least 3 vertices
4089 error_count++;
4090 std::cerr << "failed: getTriangleVertices() - Segment " << i
4091 << " has too few vertices: Expected at least 3, got "
4092 << triangleVertices[i].size() << "." << std::endl;
4093 }
4094 }
4095 }
4096 }
4097 }
4098 }
4099
4100 {
4101 // Test Tube::getLength() const
4102 Context context_test;
4103
4104 // Define tube properties
4105 uint objID = 1;
4106 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)}; // 2 units apart
4107 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4108 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4109 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4110
4111 // Create a tube object
4112 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4113
4114 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(tubeID)) {
4115 error_count++;
4116 std::cerr << "failed: getLength() - Tube creation failed." << std::endl;
4117 } else {
4118 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4119 if (!tube) {
4120 error_count++;
4121 std::cerr << "failed: getLength() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4122 } else {
4123 float computed_length = tube->getLength();
4124 float expected_length = 2.0f;
4125
4126 if (std::abs(computed_length - expected_length) > 1e-5) {
4127 error_count++;
4128 std::cerr << "failed: getLength() - Expected " << expected_length
4129 << ", but got " << computed_length << "." << std::endl;
4130 }
4131 }
4132 }
4133 }
4134
4135 {
4136 // Test Tube::getVolume() const
4137 Context context_test;
4138
4139 uint objID = 1;
4140 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4141 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4142 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4143 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4144
4145 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4146
4147 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(tubeID)) {
4148 error_count++;
4149 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Tube creation failed." << std::endl;
4150 } else {
4151 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4152 if (!tube) {
4153 error_count++;
4154 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4155 } else {
4156 float computed_volume = tube->getVolume();
4157
4158 // Compute expected volume
4159 float L = 2.0f;
4160 float r0 = 1.0f, r1 = 1.0f;
4161 float expected_volume = M_PI * L / 3.f * (r0 * r0 + r0 * r1 + r1 * r1);
4162
4163 if (std::abs(computed_volume - expected_volume) > 1e-5) {
4164 error_count++;
4165 std::cerr << "failed: getVolume() - Expected " << expected_volume
4166 << ", but got " << computed_volume << "." << std::endl;
4167 }
4168 }
4169 }
4170 }
4171
4172 {
4173 // Test Tube::getSegmentVolume(uint segment_index) const
4174 Context context_test;
4175
4176 uint objID = 1;
4177 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4178 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4179 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4180 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4181
4182 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4183
4184 if (!context_test.doesObjectExist(tubeID)) {
4185 error_count++;
4186 std::cerr << "failed: getSegmentVolume() - Tube creation failed." << std::endl;
4187 } else {
4188 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4189 if (!tube) {
4190 error_count++;
4191 std::cerr << "failed: getSegmentVolume() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4192 } else {
4193 uint segment_index = 0;
4194 float computed_segment_volume = tube->getSegmentVolume(segment_index);
4195
4196 // Compute expected segment volume
4197 float L = 2.0f;
4198 float r0 = 1.0f, r1 = 1.0f;
4199 float expected_segment_volume = M_PI * L / 3.f * (r0 * r0 + r0 * r1 + r1 * r1);
4200
4201 if (std::abs(computed_segment_volume - expected_segment_volume) > 1e-5) {
4202 error_count++;
4203 std::cerr << "failed: getSegmentVolume() - Expected " << expected_segment_volume
4204 << ", but got " << computed_segment_volume << "." << std::endl;
4205 }
4206 }
4207 }
4208 }

4214 uint objID = 1;

4218

4220 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4221
4222 if (!tube) {
4223 error_count++;
4224 std::cerr << "failed: setTubeRadii() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4225 } else {
4226 std::vector<float> new_radii = {0.5f, 0.8f};
4227 tube->setTubeRadii(new_radii);
4228 std::vector<float> updated_radii = tube->getNodeRadii();
4229
4230 if (updated_radii != new_radii) {
4231 error_count++;
4232 std::cerr << "failed: setTubeRadii() - Radii not updated correctly." << std::endl;
4233 }
4234 }

4237 {
4238 // Test Tube::appendTubeSegment()
4239 Context context_test;
4240
4241 uint objID = 1;
4242 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4243 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4244 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4245 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4246
4247 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4248 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4249
4250 if (!tube) {
4251 error_count++;
4252 std::cerr << "failed: appendTubeSegment() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4253 } else {
4254 // Get initial node count using nodes vector size
4255 size_t initial_count = tube->getNodes().size(); // Replace getNodeCount()
4256
4257 // Append a new segment
4258 tube->appendTubeSegment(make_vec3(0, 0, 4), 0.8f, RGB::red);
4259
4260 // Get updated count
4261 size_t updated_count = tube->getNodes().size();
4262
4263 if (updated_count != initial_count + 1) {
4264 error_count++;
4265 std::cerr << "failed: appendTubeSegment() - Node count did not increase." << std::endl;
4266 }
4267 }
4268 }
4269
4270 {
4271 // Test Tube::pruneTubeNodes()
4272 Context context_test;
4273
4274 uint objID = 1;
4275 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2), make_vec3(0, 0, 4)};
4276 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.2f, 1.5f};
4277 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4278
4279 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, {0.1f, 0.1f, 0.1f});
4280 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4281
4282 if (!tube) {
4283 error_count++;
4284 std::cerr << "failed: pruneTubeNodes() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4285 } else {
4286 size_t initial_count = tube->getNodes().size(); // Replace getNodeCount()
4287
4288 tube->pruneTubeNodes(1);
4289 size_t updated_count = tube->getNodes().size(); // Check new node count
4290
4291 if (updated_count != 1) {
4292 error_count++;
4293 std::cerr << "failed: pruneTubeNodes() - Tube nodes not pruned correctly." << std::endl;
4294 }
4295 }
4296 }

4303 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4304 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4305 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4306 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4307
4308 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4309 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4310
4311 if (!tube) {
4312 error_count++;
4313 std::cerr << "failed: getSegmentVolume() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4314 } else {
4315 uint segment_index = 0;
4316 float computed_segment_volume = tube->getSegmentVolume(segment_index);
4317
4318 // Compute expected segment volume
4319 float L = 2.0f;
4320 float r0 = 1.0f, r1 = 1.0f;
4321 float expected_segment_volume = M_PI * L / 3.f * (r0 * r0 + r0 * r1 + r1 * r1);
4322
4323 if (std::abs(computed_segment_volume - expected_segment_volume) > 1e-5) {
4324 error_count++;
4325 std::cerr << "failed: getSegmentVolume() - Expected " << expected_segment_volume
4326 << ", but got " << computed_segment_volume << "." << std::endl;
4327 }

4331 {
4332 // Test Tube::appendTubeSegment() - Texture
4333 Context context_test;
4334
4335 uint objID = 1;
4336 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4337 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4338 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4339 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4340
4341 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4342 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4343
4344 if (!tube) {
4345 error_count++;
4346 std::cerr << "failed: appendTubeSegment() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4347 } else {
4348 size_t initial_count = tube->getNodes().size();
4349
4350 // Append a new segment with texture
4351 tube->appendTubeSegment(make_vec3(0, 0, 4), 0.8f, "lib/images/disk_texture.png", make_vec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
4352
4353 if (tube->getNodes().size() != initial_count + 1) {
4354 error_count++;
4355 std::cerr << "failed: appendTubeSegment() - Node count did not increase." << std::endl;
4356 }
4357 }
4358 }
4359
4360 {
4361 // Test Tube::scaleTubeLength()
4362 Context context_test;
4363
4364 uint objID = 1;
4365 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4366 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4367 std::vector<float> thickness = {0.1f, 0.1f};
4368 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4369
4370 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, thickness);
4371 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4372
4373 if (!tube) {
4374 error_count++;
4375 std::cerr << "failed: scaleTubeLength() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4376 } else {
4377 tube->scaleTubeLength(1.5f);
4378 std::vector<vec3> new_nodes = tube->getNodes();
4379
4380 if (std::abs((new_nodes[1] - new_nodes[0]).magnitude() - 3.0f) > 1e-5) {
4381 error_count++;
4382 std::cerr << "failed: scaleTubeLength() - Length did not scale correctly." << std::endl;
4383 }
4384 }
4385 }
4386
4387 {
4388 // Test Tube::setTubeNodes()
4389 Context context_test;
4390
4391 uint objID = 1;
4392 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 0, 2)};
4393 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.0f};
4394 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4395
4396 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, {0.1f, 0.1f});
4397 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4398
4399 if (!tube) {
4400 error_count++;
4401 std::cerr << "failed: setTubeNodes() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4402 } else {
4403 std::vector<vec3> new_positions = {make_vec3(1, 1, 1), make_vec3(2, 2, 2)};
4404 tube->setTubeNodes(new_positions);
4405 std::vector<vec3> updated_positions = tube->getNodes();
4406
4407 if (updated_positions != new_positions) {
4408 error_count++;
4409 std::cerr << "failed: setTubeNodes() - Nodes not updated correctly." << std::endl;
4410 }
4411 }
4412 }
4413
4414
4415
4416
4417 {
4418 // Final Debugging Test for Tube::scaleTubeGirth()
4419
4420 Context context_test;
4421
4422 uint objID = 1;
4423 std::vector<vec3> nodes = {
4424 make_vec3(0, 0, 0),
4425 make_vec3(0, 0, 2)
4426 };
4427 std::vector<float> radii = {1.0f, 1.2f};
4428 const char* textureFile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4429
4430 uint tubeID = context_test.addTubeObject(objID, nodes, radii, textureFile, {0.1f, 0.1f});
4431 Tube* tube = context_test.getTubeObjectPointer(tubeID);
4432
4433 if (!tube) {
4434 // If the pointer is null, report failure
4435 error_count++;
4436 std::cerr << "failed: scaleTubeGirth() - Could not retrieve tube object pointer." << std::endl;
4437 } else {
4438 float scale_factor = 1.5f;
4439
4440 // Step 1: Measure original vertex distances from nodes
4441 std::vector<std::vector<float>> original_distances;
4442 std::vector<std::vector<vec3>> original_vertices = tube->getTriangleVertices();
4443
4444 for (size_t segment = 0; segment < original_vertices.size(); segment++) {
4445 std::vector<float> segment_distances;
4446 for (const vec3& vertex : original_vertices[segment]) {
4447 float distance = (vertex - nodes[segment]).magnitude();
4448 segment_distances.push_back(distance);
4449 }
4450 original_distances.push_back(segment_distances);
4451 }
4452
4453 // Step 2: Apply scaling
4454 tube->scaleTubeGirth(scale_factor);
4455
4456 // Step 3: Measure new vertex distances
4457 std::vector<std::vector<vec3>> scaled_vertices = tube->getTriangleVertices();
4458
4459
4460 // Step 4: Compare Expected vs. Actual Values
4461 float error_tolerance = 0.02f; // Allow small floating-point errors
4462 bool test_failed = false;
4463
4464 for (size_t segment = 0; segment < scaled_vertices.size(); segment++) {
4465 for (size_t j = 0; j < scaled_vertices[segment].size(); j++) {
4466 float new_distance = (scaled_vertices[segment][j] - nodes[segment]).magnitude();
4467 float expected_distance = original_distances[segment][j] * scale_factor;
4468
4469 if (std::abs(new_distance - expected_distance) > error_tolerance) {
4470 test_failed = true;
4471 std::cerr << "failed: scaleTubeGirth() - Expected distance "
4472 << expected_distance << ", but got " << new_distance
4473 << " at segment " << segment << ", vertex " << j << "." << std::endl;
4474 }
4475 }
4476 }
4477
4478 }
4479 }
4480
4481
4482 {
4483 // Test Polymesh constructor
4484 Context context_test;
4485 uint objID = 4;
4486 std::vector<uint> UUIDs = {context_test.addTriangle(make_vec3(0, 0, 0), make_vec3(1, 0, 0), make_vec3(0, 1, 0))};
4487 const char *texturefile = "lib/images/disk_texture.png";
4488
4489 Polymesh polymesh(objID, UUIDs, texturefile, &context_test);
4490
4491 if (polymesh.getObjectID() != objID) {
4492 error_count++;
4493 std::cerr << "failed: Polymesh constructor - Object ID is incorrect." << std::endl;
4494 }
4495
4496 if (polymesh.getPrimitiveUUIDs() != UUIDs) {
4497 error_count++;
4498 std::cerr << "failed: Polymesh constructor - UUIDs mismatch." << std::endl;
4499 }
4500
4501 if (polymesh.getTextureFile() != texturefile) {
4502 error_count++;
4503 std::cerr << "failed: Polymesh constructor - Texture file name mismatch." << std::endl;
4504 }
4505 }
4506
4507

4510 // Test Polymesh::getVolume() const
4511 Context context_test;
4512 uint objID = 6;

4514
4515 Polymesh polymesh(objID, UUIDs, "lib/images/disk_texture.png", &context_test);
4516
4517 float volume = polymesh.getVolume();
4518
4519 if (volume < 0) {
4520 error_count++;
4521 std::cerr << "failed: Polymesh::getVolume() returned an invalid volume." << std::endl;
4522 }
4523 }

4588 vec3 node0 = make_vec3(0, 0, 0);

4591 float radius1 = 3.0f;
4592 uint subdiv = 6;
4593
4594 Cone cone(OID, UUIDs, node0, node1, radius0, radius1, subdiv, "", &context_test);
4595

4597 if (cone.getNodeRadius(0) != radius0) {
4598 error_count++;
4599 std::cerr << "failed: Cone::getNodeRadius(0) returned incorrect value." << std::endl;
4600 }
4601
4602 if (cone.getNodeRadius(1) != radius1) {
4603 error_count++;
4604 std::cerr << "failed: Cone::getNodeRadius(1) returned incorrect value." << std::endl;
4605 }
4606

4618 float radius1 = 2.0f;

4625 vec3 retrievedNode1 = cone.getNodeCoordinate(1);
4626

4628 error_count++;

4630 }

4647 float radius1 = 3.5f;
4648 uint initial_subdiv = 4;
4649 uint new_subdiv = 8;
4650

4655
